repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits.

summary.p: The first volume of a 11-volume manuscript copy of the diary of Ananda Ranga Pillai (ஆனந்தரங்கம் பிள்ளை).

The full multi-volume manuscript covers the years 1736 to 1760. It was commissioned by Édouard Ariel. Apparently originally independent bundles were bound as codices, possibly at the order of Édouard Ariel (since the titles on the spine are in Tamil).

The present volume contains:
bundle 1: 1736 to 1745.
bundle 2: 1745 to 1746.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (March 2025).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

2 + 219 folios = Bundle 2 (1745-1746). White yellowish paper. 220 x 345 mm. Foliation A-B, then 1-219.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. White paper. 220 x 345 mm. Blank recto verso. Element of binding.

origin.origDate: Bundle 1 revised in May 1850 (and possibly written as early as 1849). Bundle 2 revised in 1851. See colophons: U1, fBv and U2, fBv.

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. — See BnF, Département des Manuscrits, Inventaire 7 = dons : manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, n° 1 à 3306: no. 1192.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
